TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PhysicalAddress extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides the Media Access Control (MAC) address for a network interface (adapter).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MAC address, or physical address, is a hardware address that uniquely identifies each node, such as a computer or printer, on a network.
Instances of this class are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface.GetPhysicalAddress%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
## Examples The following code example displays the physical addresses of all interfaces on the local computer.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CPP/NCLPhysicalAddress.cpp" id="Snippet2"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CS/physaddresstester.cs" id="Snippet2":::

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] address) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In common scenarios, applications do not need to call this constructor; instances of this class are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface.GetPhysicalAddress%2A> method.
Note that you can also use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.Parse%2A> method to create a new instance of <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress>.
## Examples The following code example creates a new <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> object.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CPP/NCLPhysicalAddress.cpp" id="Snippet4"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CS/physaddresstester.cs" id="Snippet4":::

Docs.returns: if this instance and the specified instance contain the same address; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly None As PhysicalAddress

Docs.summary: Returns a new instance with a zero length address. This field is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.Parse%2A> method returns <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.None> if you specify `null` address.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using this field to test the result of parsing an address.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CPP/NCLPhysicalAddress.cpp" id="Snippet5"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CS/physaddresstester.cs" id="Snippet5":::

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress Parse(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<char> address) cil managed
Public Shared Function Parse (address As ReadOnlySpan(Of Char)) As PhysicalAddress

Docs.param: A span containing the address that will be used to initialize the instance returned by this method.
Docs.summary: Parses the specified span and stores its contents as the address bytes of the returned by this method.
Docs.returns: A instance with the specified address.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `address` parameter must contain a string that can only consist of numbers and upper-case letters as hexadecimal digits. Some examples of string formats that are acceptable are as follows:
`001122334455`
`00-11-22-33-44-55`
`F0-E1-D2-C3-B4-A5`
Note that an address that contains `f0-e1-d2-c3-b4-a5` will fail to parse and throw an exception.
Use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.GetAddressBytes%2A> method to retrieve the address from an existing <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> instance.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> instance by calling the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.Parse%2A> method.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CS/physaddresstester.cs" id="Snippet6":::

Docs.exception: contains an illegal hardware address or contains a string in the incorrect format.

`001122334455`

`F0-E1-D2-C3-B4-A5`
Note that an address that contains `f0-e1-d2-c3-b4-a5` will fail to parse and throw an exception.
Use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.GetAddressBytes%2A> method to retrieve the address from an existing <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> instance.

:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CPP/NCLPhysicalAddress.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLPhysicalAddress/CS/physaddresstester.cs" id="Snippet3":::

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryParse (ReadOnlySpan<char> address, out System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress? value);
.method public static hidebysig bool TryParse(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<char> address, [out] class System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress& value) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryParse (address As ReadOnlySpan(Of Char), ByRef value As PhysicalAddress) As Boolean
static member TryParse : ReadOnlySpan<char> * PhysicalAddress -> bool
public: static bool TryParse(ReadOnlySpan<char> address, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::Net::NetworkInformation::PhysicalAddress ^ % value);

Docs.param: A span containing the address that will be used to initialize the instance returned by this method.

When this method returns, contains the instance equivalent of the address contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or if the conversion failed. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in will be overwritten.
Docs.summary: Tries to convert the span representation of a hardware address to a instance. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `address` parameter must contain a string that can only consist of numbers and upper-case letters as hexadecimal digits. Some examples of string formats that are legal are as follows:
`001122334455`
`00-11-22-33-44-55`
`F0-E1-D2-C3-B4-A5`
Note that an address that contains `f0-e1-d2-c3-b4-a5` is illegal.
Use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.GetAddressBytes%2A> method to retrieve the address from an existing <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> instance.

Docs.param: A string containing the address that will be used to initialize the instance returned by this method.

When this method returns, contains the instance equivalent of the address contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or if the conversion failed. If the is it contains . This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in will be overwritten.
Docs.summary: Tries to convert the string representation of a hardware address to a instance. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `address` parameter must contain a string that can only consist of numbers and upper-case letters as hexadecimal digits. Some examples of string formats that are legal are as follows:
`001122334455`
`00-11-22-33-44-55`
`F0-E1-D2-C3-B4-A5`
Note that an address that contains `f0-e1-d2-c3-b4-a5` is illegal.
Use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress.GetAddressBytes%2A> method to retrieve the address from an existing <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PhysicalAddress> instance.
